file_content.text: [This holocommunicator is not receiving any signals.]
Ah! Hello again. Scans show the soil devastators in full operation. Excellent.
Thank you for taking the time to assist us. The operation would have failed without you.
No problem.
It was simple, really.
Don't expect help next time.
Understood, understood. You don't need to worry about us.
I've arranged for a small token of my gratitude to be sent to you. Thanks again.
...in, repeat, come in... poor reception... please reattempt when objective is complete....
...come in, Torsin. This is headquarters. Lieutenant Torsin, please respond. Sir, we've got something!
What? Lieutenant Torsin, is that you? Blast it, Nalto, get me a clear visual!
That's bett--oh. Apologies, my lord. I didn't recognize you. I--is there a lieutenant by the name of Torsin with you by any chance?
There are many slain soldiers here. Your lieutenant is most likely among them.
He's probably dead.
What are you supposed to be, some kind of mercenary? What happened to my team? Where's Torsin?
Do not make demands of us, soldier.
Mind your tone.
No need to get angry. A merc can tell you your men are dead just as well as anyone else.
Take it easy.
This one's with me. And I'm with Imperial Intelligence. Why don't you tell us what's going on here?
Stay calm.
Intelligence? Finally, some good news.
There we--oh. Agent. Finally, some good news. Can you tell me what the situation is there? Is Lieutenant Torsin with you?
Listen, I need to speak with a man named Torsin. He's a soldier, a lieutenant in the Imperial Army--is he there with you?
If you wish to speak, Imperial, you will speak to me.
Address me only.
My lord! Thank you for... gracing us with your involvement.
This holo was sitting in a pile of corpses. Perhaps your friend is among them--why don't you describe him?
He's probably dead.
That, uh, that's not really necessary, my lord.
All we've got here is corpses, pal.
He's probably dead.
This holo was on the body of a dead Imperial soldier--one of several.
I'm afraid he's probably KIA.
Then it's what we feared.
Is there a problem?
Lieutenant who?
A squad of Imperial soldiers, led by a man named Torsin--they aren't there? Then it's what we feared.
Torsin's squad was deployed to recapture that region's farmsteads. The resistance is desperate for supplies, pushing to capture every food source available.
I hoped to retake the farms and put their crops to our use. That's no longer an option.
We have to destroy the crops on those farmsteads. We cannot allow the enemy access to such a valuable resource. You're already in the area--can you help us?
If we cannot kill them directly, we will starve them instead.
Gladly.
Opportunities to spread famine are so rare.
Of course.
You honor us with your time, my lord.
As long as there's money in it, I'll torch all the farms you want.
You bet.
Your time will be compensated. And there's no need to waste ordnance scorching the area--we have a simpler plan.
No Imperial resource will fall into the enemy's hands.
You can count on me.
I suppose I could.
Torsin's squad was carrying a set of RK-9 soil devastators, for this contingency. They'll be on the soldiers' bodies.
Once you have the soil devastators, fight past the resistance patrols and position them in the growing fields. The devices will blight the soil beyond all use.
If you could, contact me again when the objective is complete. Good luck to you.
Do it yourself. [Refuse quest]
Hmm. Understood. Don't know how we'll pull this off now....
[This holocommunicator is not receiving any signals.]
